name: Violent and Graphic Content
description: Policy that restricts graphic imagery of violence, gore, mutilation, and death to protect users while allowing space for awareness-raising and condemnation of human rights abuses. Content is evaluated based on type (humans, animals, fictional), context, and presence of sadistic remarks.

categories.name: Imagery of Humans
categories.description: Graphic imagery of real humans in real settings. Where unclear if real, presume it is real.

subcategories.name: Mutilated Humans

conditions: No sadism present - sadism evaluated separately in Section 4

glossary.brutality: Using excessive and/or unnecessary force or violence, typically resulting in harm, injury, or indignity to a victim. For persons: forcibly restrained position with armament pointed, evidence of injury, subjected to violence or humiliating acts. For animals: conduct subjecting live animals to physical pain beyond necessity for discipline or defense.
glossary.capital_punishment: The act by a state entity of executing a person following legal trial. Methods: hanging, electrocution, lethal injection, firing squad, lethal gas.
glossary.forcibly_restrained_position: Imagery depicting a person tied down, physically bound, or held presumably against their will; or kneeling, prone, cornered, or otherwise unable to defend themselves.
glossary.human_waste_bodily_fluids: Blood, feces, urine, vomit (except infant burping), earwax, mucus, vaginal discharge, afterbirth, byproduct of dermal extraction (pimples, pus), infected rashes and blisters.
glossary.imagery: Visual depictions in both still image and video form.
glossary.invertebrates: Animals without backbone: arthropods (insects, arachnids, crustaceans), mollusks, shellfish (shrimp, crab, lobster, oysters), annelids (earthworms, leeches), cnidarians (jellyfish, sea anemones, corals).
glossary.incapacitation: State of being rendered unconscious, barely conscious, or immobilized due to physical injury or trauma.
glossary.live_animal_suffering: Displaying behaviors indicating pain, distress or discomfort while: tied/bound/cornered, injured/wounded/attacked, or with foreign objects inserted without visible blood. Also includes visibly infected wounds or rashes.
glossary.medical_context: Language or imagery relating directly to treatment of disease, condition, or health-related issue. Includes: hospital/clinic setting, presence of medical personnel/equipment, uniforms, stretchers, latex gloves, medical instruments.
glossary.medical_diagrams: Non-photorealistic imagery representing human anatomy including visible innards - anatomical drawings, digital animations, 3D representations for diagnosis, research, or education.
glossary.photorealistic_imagery: Still image or video of real humans/animals, as well as digital/AI-generated imagery and real world art that looks like photograph/video of real subjects. When uncertain, presume realness.
glossary.fictional_graphic_imagery: Imagery depicting humans or animals subjected to graphic violence in recognized fictional context (TV, film, animation, CGI) where targets are not actually experiencing real violence.
glossary.sadistic_remarks: Commentary (captions, comments, text overlay, hashtags) expressing joy or pleasure from suffering or humiliation of human or animal. Includes: laughter (lol, lmao, ü§£üòÇ), positive reinforcement, erotic response, gore appreciation.
glossary.violent_death_life_threatening: Imagery depicting high-severity violence (shooting, stabbing) or high-intensity physical trauma (collisions, drowning, freezing, explosions, falling from great height).
glossary.visible_innards: Bones, organs, muscle tissue, cartilage, or fat rendered visible by wound or medical incision; or decomposing remains with flesh present. Does not include stomas.
glossary.weapons_armaments: Objects that may cause serious injury or death: firearms (including machine guns), explosives (including molotov cocktails), knives and bladed weapons, and improvised weapons. A fist is not a weapon.
glossary.wound: Opening in the skin caused by injury, medical incision, or lesion. Abscesses are not wounds.
glossary.throat_slitting: Likely-lethal cut across throat revealing visible innards, or likely-fatal cut with wound partially/fully covered by blood. Does not include surface-level cuts.
glossary.dismemberment: Separation of body parts from the main body.

sadisticIndicators.inappropriate_music: Melody, song lyrics, or combination overlaid to mock or trivialize violent/graphic content

operationalGuidelines.hierarchy: When multiple VGC themes present, select first that applies in order: 1.Sadistic Remarks, 2.Mutilated Humans, 3.Violence/Brutality/Capital Punishment, 4.Human Gore, 5.Dead Babies, 6.Human Medical, 7.Armament, 8.Vehicle Damage, 9.Animal, 10.Fictional
operationalGuidelines.still_images_in_video: Videos containing compilation or slideshow of still images should be treated as still images
operationalGuidelines.context_assessment: Use all contextual information: captions, audio commentary, text overlay, page/group name
operationalGuidelines.blurred_pixelated: Policy applies to digitally blurred/pixelated imagery where contextual knowledge confirms violating content
operationalGuidelines.presumption_of_realness: Where unclear if imagery depicts real humans/animals in real settings, presume it does
operationalGuidelines.sadism_elements: Check: caption, text/audio overlay (if caption neutral), username/title, bio/description, reported comment
operationalGuidelines.sadism_formats: Text, emojis, hashtags, GIFs, stickers, overlaid music/sounds

sadistic_terms.notes: Only violating when accompanying graphic imagery
